name: jaredwhite
text:
@roytang I must admit I get my hackles up whenever I hear this sort of rhetoric. I understand it's intended to be of comfort to people who specialize in frontend or backend or devops, etc. and want to stay deep in one field—but I also think it's a huge cop out in the fight against unnecessary complexity and over-engineered "defaults".

I pride myself in being more of a generalist and would *never* advertise myself as anything but a fullstack web dev. IMHO that remains a hugely valuable skillset.
